ClinicalDocument.title: Sean J. Johnson Hospital Visit Summary

assignedAuthoringDevice.manufacturerModelName: Mariana Lin, MD, Sean J. Johnson Hospital
assignedAuthoringDevice.softwareName: Mariana Lin, MD, Sean J. Johnson Hospital

name.given: Sue Erokan, MD, Sean J. Johnson Hospital

section.title: Reason for Visit
section.text: Skin Cancer Screening: Referred by PCP, Sue Erokan, MD

tr.td: Once daily, as needed for allergies
Two puffs per day, each nostril as needed for seasonal allergies

substanceAdministration.text: inhale 2 puffs by inhalation route at least 15 minutes before exertion for 30 days

code.displayName: Proventil HFA Inhalation HFA Aerosol Inhaler 90 mcg/actuation

translation.displayName: 200 ACTUAT Albuterol 0.09 MG/ACTUAT Metered Dose Inhaler

tr.td: Patient referred from PCP for routine skin cancer screening; Fitzpatrick skin type III. No HX of melanoma and did not observe any changes in any of his nevi. No family hx of melanoma, SCC or BCC.

1. Atypical nevus on upper left forearm, 6 mm, irregular and ill-defined border, variegated color and asymmetric shape. Patient reports that he has the nevus since puberty and that no changes were observed over the last few years.
2. Benign Lentigo of 1 cm in diameter, located on the right cheek.
3. All other Nevi and freckles are unremarkable.

- Monitor any change in size and color of the atypical mole. If you observe any changes please come back in for exam.
- Commuter's left ears are exposed to more sunlight. Consider wearing a hat during commute, especially on sunny days in the afternoon.
- Wear sunscreen and avoid prolonged exposure to sun.
- Please schedule followup in 12 months.
